abstract: Displacement of forest dwellers, known as Bambote, in Democratic Republic of Congo is latest example highlighting deep-seated issues in federal infrastructure that show government inability to provide security to its people; bloody war with neighboring ethnic group Luba led to many casualties and displacement of people from both groups fleeing war.

headline.print_headline: Where Wars Are Small and Chaos Is Endless
headline.main: In Congo, Wars Are Small and Chaos Is Endless

snippet: Traditional forest dwellers, known for their capacity to cooperate, have become embroiled in and displaced by one of the conflicts that typify the Democratic Republic of Congo as an election crisis looms.
lead_paragraph: Traditional forest dwellers, known for their capacity to cooperate, have become embroiled in and displaced by one of the conflicts that typify the Democratic Republic of Congo as an election crisis looms.
